full_summary:
### Good Samaritan Personal Protective Equipment Tender Announcement

#### Reference Information
Tender Identification Number: cb-630-13124607  
Amendment Number: 7  
Tender Identification Number: ECJM-RFP-2023-2067

#### Description
The Government of Canada's Office of the Chief Electoral Officer of Canada is seeking a vendor to provide Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) items for use during federal elections and by-elections. The goods and materials required include, but are not limited to:

* Disposable surgical masks
* Transparent face masks
* Hand sanitizer (alcohol-free and alcohol-based)
* Disinfectant wipes
* Face shields
* Disposable gloves

Vendors may submit unit prices for one or more, or all of the above items.

#### Tender Requirements
*The estimated contract period is anticipated to be from the date of award to December 30, 2024, with two optional extension periods from December 31, 2024 to December 30, 2025, and from December 31, 2025 to December 30, 2026.*  
The incumbent contractor does not exist. Security requirements do not apply to this procurement.

#### Tender Submission

*   This request for proposal allows vendors to transmit their submission electronically using the Connect service provided by Canada Post Corporation.
*   Vendors must refer to Part 2 – Bidder Instructions, and Part 3 – Proposal Preparation Instructions in the tender documents.
*   Proposals must be addressed to the attention of the Contracting Authority and delivered, sealed, to the Proposal Receiving Unit on or before the tender closing date and time.
*   Vendors may not send bids via email or facsimile.

#### Selection Criteria
The contract will be awarded using a competitive procurement strategy based on the lowest cost.

#### General Information

*   Vendors may obtain the solicitation documents for this request for proposal through 
    [canadabuys.canada.ca/en/tender-opportunities](http://canadabuys.canada.ca/en/tender-opportunities).
*   Further information about Elections Canada may be obtained at [elections.ca](http://elections.ca).
*   Once the successful bidder has been announced, vendors may request a debriefing on the results of the request for proposal process. 
*   Bidding is open only to those who have submitted a bid in accordance with the instructions provided in the tender package.
*   Bids sent via email or facsimile will not be accepted
